title: Hollyoaks spoilers: Luke exposes the truth as Breda frees Tony
text:
(Picture: Lime Pictures)

Hollyoaks’ signature stunt week is set to be anything but smooth for the residents of Chester, as chaos and devastation ensues. However, prior to the devastation, Luke Morgan (Gary Lucy) learns a shocking secret as the day of DJ’s christening arrives, while Breda McQueen (Moya Brady) toys with the idea of letting prisoner Tony Hutchinson (Nick Pickard) walk free.

In the coming episodes, Luke comes to learn the truth about DJ’s parentage, and he’s shocked as a result. On the revelation, actor Gary Lucy said: ‘It completely spins him out. He feels a whole mix of emotions, he feels betrayed by Ollie and Cindy. As a father, I can relate to how heart breaking it must feel to have lost out on all of the times with baby DJ, the big moments.’

However, in spite of Luke having realised that DJ is his son, he decides against revealing the truth.

Gary said: ‘As hard as it is I think Luke makes the right call and realises that it’s the right thing to do, to not break up the family unit that is forming with Darren and Mandy. Plus, he’s fallen off the wagon at this point so he’s not sure if he is capable of being the dad that the baby deserves.’

Luke is invited to DJ’s christening, and ultimately, he decides to attend — although he promises not to cause any trouble. However, problems later ensue when he comes to the realisation that Cindy (Stephanie Waring) was aware of the truth and failed to let him know. How will he react?

That’s not the only drama taking place in the village prior to the chaos, as Breda begins to fear that her family will soon discover the truth, and thus she comes to believe that there’s no other option than for Tony to die.

However, Tony pleads for his life, and manages to convince the serial killer that she could hand herself in and, in effect, let him go. We know that Breda toys with the idea, but whether or not she follows through has yet to be revealed.

Will Breda agree to let Tony go home to his family?

Hollyoaks continues Friday 25th October at 7pm on E4.
